trans-unit.source: Represents a collection of <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle"></xref> objects that is in a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView"></xref> control.
The TreeNodeStyleCollection class is used to store and manage a collection of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle> objects.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView.LevelStyles%2A> property, of type TreeNodeStyleCollection, stores the node styles for the individual levels of a tree.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView.LevelStyles%2A> property is an alternative to the individual style properties, such as the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView.NodeStyle%2A> property, that control node styles at different levels of the tree.
The first style in the collection corresponds to the node style in the first level of the tree.
The second style in the collection corresponds to the node style in the second level of the tree, and so on.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView.LevelStyles%2A> property is most often used to generate table of contentsâ€“style navigation menus where nodes at a certain level should have the same appearance, regardless of whether they have child nodes.
The TreeNodeStyleCollection class inherits most of its members from the <xref:System.Web.UI.StateManagedCollection> class.
For more information about the inherited members, see <xref:System.Web.UI.StateManagedCollection>.
Appends the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle"></xref> object to the end of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyleCollection"></xref> object.
Use the Add method to append the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle> object to the end of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyleCollection> object.
> [!NOTE] > The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyleCollection> allows you to add `null`, as well as duplicate <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle> objects.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle"></xref> to append.
The position into which the new <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle"></xref> was inserted.
Determines whether the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle"></xref> object is in the collection.
Use the Contains method to determine whether a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle> object is contained in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyleCollection> object.

The Contains method is commonly used to test for the existence of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle> object before performing a task, such as adding or removing the node from the collection.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle"></xref> to find.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>, if the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle"></xref> object is contained in the collection; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.

Copies all the items from the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyleCollection"></xref> object to a compatible one-dimensional array of <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle"></xref> objects, starting at the specified index in the target array.

Use the CopyTo method to copy the contents of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyleCollection> object into the specified zero-based array of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle> objects.
Items are copied starting at the specified index of the target array.
You can then use the array to access the items in the collection.

A zero-based array of <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle"></xref> objects that receives the copied items from the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyleCollection"></xref>.
The position in the target array at which to start receiving the copied content.
To be added.
To be added.
To be added.
Determines the index of the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle"></xref> object in the collection.
Use the IndexOf method to determine the zero-based index of the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle> object in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyleCollection> object.
If the node is not in the collection, the method returns -1.
> [!NOTE] > If the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle> object appears multiple times in the collection, the index of the first occurrence is returned.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle"></xref> to locate.
The zero-based index of the first occurrence of style within the , if found; otherwise, -1.

Inserts the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle"></xref> object into the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyleCollection"></xref> object at the specified index location.

Use the Insert method to insert the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle> object into the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyleCollection> object at the specified zero-based index.

As an alternative, you can append a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle> object to the end of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyleCollection> by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyleCollection.Add%2A> method.
The zero-based index location at which to insert the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle"></xref> to insert.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle"></xref> object at the specified index in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyleCollection"></xref> object.

Use the Item index property to access a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle> object from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyleCollection> object at the specified index by using array notation.
The collection is zero-based.
The zero-based index of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle"></xref> to retrieve.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle"></xref> at the specified index in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyleCollection"></xref>.
To be added.
To be added.
Removes the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle"></xref> object from the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyleCollection"></xref> object.
Use the Remove method to remove the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle> object from the collection.
The indexes of the remaining objects are updated to be consecutive.
As an alternative, you can remove a node at specific index by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyleCollection.RemoveAt%2A> method.
You can also remove every node in the collection by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.StateManagedCollection.Clear%2A> method.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle"></xref> to remove.
Removes the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle"></xref> object at the specified index location from the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyleCollection"></xref> object.

Use the RemoveAt method to remove the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle> object at the specified zero-based index location from a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyleCollection> object.
All the items that are located after the removed node are then moved up one level to fill the vacant position in the tree structure.
The indexes of the moved items are also updated.
As an alternative, you can remove a specific <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle> object by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyleCollection.Remove%2A> method.
You can also remove every node in the collection by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeCollection.Clear%2A> method.
The zero-based index location of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle"></xref> to remove.
To be added.
